subtitle.text: Amazing Animals
The Big Eater in the Grasslands:Elephant
Elephants live in grasslands and forests in Africa and India.
They eat grass, leaves, fruit, and flowers.
They can eat more than 300kg a day.
‘300kg’ is the weight of about 2,000 bananas.
In other words, elephants need to eat 2,000 bananas a day to be full enough.
They only have four teeth, so they don’t eat meat.
And yet, they eat a lot!
The Big Eater in the Grasslands: Elephant
Elephants live in grasslands and forests in Africa and India.
They eat grass, leaves, fruit, and flowers.
They can eat more than 300kg a day.
Roughly how much is ‘300kg?’
‘300kg’ is the weight of about 2,000 bananas.
In other words, elephants need to eat 2,000 bananas a day to be full enough.
They only have four teeth, so they don’t eat meat.
And yet, they eat a lot!
Wow! They're amamzing!
The World’s Slowest Sleepyhead: Sloth
Sloths live in South American tropical forests.
They eat the leaves, fruit, and sometimes green shoots.
Sloths spend much of their lives in treetops, snoozing.
They sleep 15 to 20 hours a day.
So there’s not much time left to hang about in trees.
They move at a slow pace through the trees.
On average, sloths travel 41 yards per day—less than half the length of a football field!

The Mysterious Singer Under the Sea: Humpback Whale

When a humpback whale swims or jumps in the water, it’s like watching
a fantastic show in nature!
Both male and female whales can make sounds.
But it’s the male whales that sing the most beautiful and mysterious songs.
The male whales can change them a little bit each year.
Sometimes they add a new phrase or chop it out.
Then the songs become very special indeed.
